dataset_id: AirMOSS: L2/3 Volumetric Soil Moisture Profiles Derived From Radar, 2012-2015
title: AirMOSS: L2/3 Volumetric Soil Moisture Profiles Derived From Radar, 2012-2015
summary: This dataset provides level 2/3 root zone soil moisture (RZSM) estimates at multiple depths at 90-m spatial resolution from the Airborne Microwave Observatory of Subcanopy and Subsurface (AirMOSS) radar instrument collected over ten sites across North America. AirMOSS produces estimates of RZSM with data from a P-band synthetic aperture radar (SAR) flown on a NASA Gulfstream-III aircraft. The resulting soil moisture estimates capture the effects of gradients of soil, topography, and vegetation heterogeneity over an area of approximately 100km x 25km at each of the study sites. AirMOSS flight campaigns took place at least biannually from 2012 to 2015 at each site.

cmr.title: AirMOSS: L2/3 Volumetric Soil Moisture Profiles Derived From Radar, 2012-2015

citation: Tabatabaeenejad, A., R.H. Chen, M.S. Burgin, X. Duan, R.H. Cuenca, M.H. Cosh, R.L. Scott, and M. Moghaddam. 2020. Assessment and Validation of AirMOSS P-Band Root-Zone Soil Moisture Products. IEEE Transactions on Geoscience and Remote Sensing. 58(9):6181-6196.

Crow, W.T., S. Milak, M. Moghaddam, A. Tabatabaeenejad, S. Jaruwatanadilok, X. Yu, Y. Shi, R.H. Reichle, Y. Hagimoto, and R.H. Cuenca. 2018. Spatial and Temporal Variability of Root-Zone Soil Moisture Acquired From Hydrologic Modeling and AirMOSS P-Band Radar. IEEE Journal of Selected Topics in Applied Earth Observations and Remote Sensing. 11(12):4578-4590.
